title: Fresh Blocks Market
narrative: Neighbors converted an abandoned lot into a seasonal night market that keeps 14 urban farms profitable while youth narrators share budgeting lessons with every visitor.

title: Harbor Apprenticeship Fund
narrative: Former dock workers and students pair up on paid apprenticeships. The fund matches stipends for every hour residents volunteer to mentor new talent.

title: Southside Solar Studio
narrative: Makers, electricians, and storytellers co-designed a solar studio that powers a free podcast booth where families narrate monthly money decisions.

title: Riverwalk Micro-Grants
narrative: A participatory budget board funds micro-ideas—shade, sound trails, low-cost seating—that make the river trail safe for late-shift workers heading home.

title: Care Ledger Pilot
narrative: Community doulas use an open ledger to log visits and micro-grants. Residents can filter the ledger to unlock stipends for transportation or groceries.

title: Neighborhood Resonance Lab
narrative: Musicians and data journalists record oral histories, turning them into sonic maps that reveal how budgets change across corridors.
